message.content: {"id": "13269", "title": "Incorrect operation order in jarpackager", "description": "When using the jarpackager, the operation order is incorrect. This issue also applies to the '.jardesc' file. It would be better to have a warning in the wizard's header, along with the icon, instead of a dialog box at the end for the '.jardesc' file. To resolve this, the 'save the manifest in the workspace' option should be combined with the 'reuse and save the manifest in the workspace' option. Moreover, when the user chooses not to overwrite the manifest file, the message 'saving manifest file failed' should not be displayed as it is not a failure in this case. The wizard should not fail to complete its operation when not overwriting this file. Additionally, the 'use existing manifest from workspace' option should not save a new manifest file.", "OB": "The jar file is created before the overwrite verifications happen.", "EB": "Ensure that not overwriting the file does not prevent the wizard from completing its operation. Implement changes so that the 'use existing manifest from workspace' option does not save a new manifest file.", "SR": "Modify the operation order in the jarpackager to address the issue with the '.jardesc' file. Display a warning in the wizard's header, along with the icon, rather than a dialog box at the end for the '.jardesc' file. Modify the message 'saving manifest file failed' so that it is not displayed when the user chooses not to overwrite the manifest file. Ensure that the wizard does not fail to complete its operation when not overwriting the manifest file. Implement changes so that the 'use existing manifest from workspace' option does not save a new manifest file."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '13269', 'title': 'Bug 13269Incorrect operation order in jarpackager', 'description': "Bug 13269Incorrect operation order in jarpackager Same goes for '.jardesc' file.prehaps a warning in the wizard's header (now that an icon is shown as well)would be better in the case of the '.jardesc' file then a dialog box at theend. If the user wants that they should use the 'save the manifest inthe workspace' option combined with the 'reuse and save the manifest in theworkspace' option.20020409. JRT. ", 'OB': "This is because the jar file is created before the overwriteverifications happen.Other notes:the messages 'saving manifest file failed' is perhaps incorrect in this caseas the user chose not to overwrite the manifest file (thus it is not really afailure). ", 'EB': "Either way not overwriting this file should not cause the wizard to notcomplete its operation.The 'use existing manifest from workspace' option should not save a newmanifest file. ", 'SR': ''}
